edu.harvard.cs262.GameServer

Interface GameServer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GameClusterServer

    public interface GameServer
extends java.rmi.Remote
    A GameServer is a general interface for the methods the server must implement in order to properly interact with the client and the game being played.
    Version:
    1.0, April 2014
    Author:
    Twitch Plays Battleship Group

    • Method Summary

      This method is called so that someone, usually the client, can get a surface-level of the game for the user to view.

    • Method Detail

      • sendCommand

        GameSnapshot sendCommand(GameCommand command)
                         throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                NotMasterException
        This method is used by a client to ask this server to execute a command in the game.
        Parameters:
        command - A GameCommand sent by the client for the server to execute
        Returns:
        A snapshot that describes what the game looks like now for the client to see the effect of recent move(s)
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - when a communication error occurs. Required by extending RMI.
        NotMasterException - when the command is sent to this server, and this is not the master. Client then knows to find the master.

      • getSnapshot

        GameSnapshot getSnapshot()
                         throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                NotMasterException
        This method is called so that someone, usually the client, can get a surface-level of the game for the user to view.
        Returns:
        A snapshot that describes what the game looks like now for the client to see the effect of recent move(s)
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - when a communication error occurs. Required by extending RMI.
        NotMasterException - when the command is sent to this server, and this is not the master. Client then knows to find the master.

      • setState

        boolean setState(GameState state)
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method would be called to update this server's impression of the current game.
        Parameters:
        state - A GameState the server should update to. The server should forget its idea of the current game state and replace it with state.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating if the state was properly updated.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - when a communication error occurs. Required by extending RMI.

      • addPeer

        boolean addPeer(java.util.UUID id,
              GameServer server)
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        When a new server enters the system, the server will be useless until other peers know about it. This method is used to add the new peer to a list of peers implementing the back end of the system.
        Parameters:
        id - The UUID of the new peer server being added to the system
        server - The GameServer that is to be added to the system
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating if the peer server was successfully added
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - when a communication error occurs. Required by extending RMI.

      • removePeer

        boolean removePeer(java.util.UUID id)
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        When a peer goes down, the rest of the system needs to remove the peer from their list of peers. This method is used to do so.
        Parameters:
        id - The UUID of the peer server that should be removed from the system
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating if the peer server was properly removed.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - when a communication error occurs. Required by extending RMI.

      • setPeers

        boolean setPeers(java.util.Hashtable<java.util.UUID,GameServer> peers)
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        For a new peer, or a thoroughly confused one, the complete list of peers can be set with this method.
        Parameters:
        peers - A Hashtable of UUIDs and GameServers that are currently working in the system
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating if the peer list was properly set on this server
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - when a communication error occurs. Required by extending RMI.

      • getState

        GameState getState()
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        To pull this server's impression of the entire game, one can call this method and be returned an GameState of what this server thinks is the current situation.
        Returns:
        A GameState that describes the entire state of the game as far as this server knows.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - when a communication error occurs. Required by extending RMI.

      • pingServer

        boolean pingServer()
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        For others to make sure that a server is up and responsive, they can ping each other as a heart beat check.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating if the server is still alive
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - when a communication error occurs. Required by extending RMI.

      • getUUID

        java.util.UUID getUUID()
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Hi, what's your name? this method allows servers to ask each other for their UUIDs.
        Returns:
        a UUID of the server
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - when a communication error occurs. Required by extending RMI.

      • getPeers

        java.util.Hashtable<java.util.UUID,GameServer> getPeers()
                                                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Ask the server for its knowledge of the working peer servers.
        Returns:
        A Hashtable relating all the UUIDs and GameServer objects of the peer servers in the system
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - when a communication error occurs. Required by extending RMI.

      • startLeaderElection

        java.lang.Object startLeaderElection()
                                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Tells the server to start the leader election protocol because a past master has gone down. Called by an ``elector'' server on all participating peers.
        Returns:
        An object that the elector needs to run the leader election protocol - implementation defined
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - when a communication error occurs. Required by extending RMI.

      • runLeaderElection

        boolean runLeaderElection()
                          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Tells the server to begin the entire leader election protocol because a past master has gone down. Called when a server detects the master is down.
        Returns:
        boolean - true when new leader has been selected and all peers have been notified. False if this server did not serve as elector.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - when a communication error occurs. Required by extending RMI.

      • closeLeaderElection

        boolean closeLeaderElection(java.util.UUID id,
                          GameServer newLeader)
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        The leader election protocol has completed. A new master has been chosen. Long live the king.
        Parameters:
        id - The UUID of the new master server
        newLeader - The GameServer that is the new master
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating that this server has updated its knowledge of who the master is
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - when a communication error occurs. Required by extending RMI.

      • getMaster

        GameServer getMaster()
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Ask who the current master is, as far as this server knows.
        Returns:
        Reference to the server that is currently the master.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - when a communication error occurs. Required by extending RMI.

      • isMaster

        boolean isMaster()
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Ask this server if it is the master of the system.
        Returns:
        Boolean indicating whether or not this server is currently the master.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - when a communication error occurs. Required by extending RMI.

      • simulateCrash

        boolean simulateCrash()
                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Simulate a server failure
        Returns:
        Boolean indicating success
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - when a communication error occurs. Required by extending RMI.
